case_title: ABDUL WAHID KHAN vs CUSTODIAN OF EVACUEE PROPERTY, WEST PAKISTAN, KARACHI AND Other
respondant: Custodian of Evacuee Property, West Pakistan, Karachi

accussed_details.name: Abdul Wahid Khan
allegation: Illegal construction and possession of excess area

complaint_summary: Abdul Wahid Khan challenged the transfer of evacuee property plots and shops situated on Anderson Road, Quetta, alleging that the orders were passed without lawful authority.
investigation_summary: Multiple inquiries revealed irregularities in Abdul Wahid Khan's possession and construction on evacuee property, including exceeding the allotted area and benefiting from favorable lease terms.
judgment_summary: The court dismissed the petition, finding Abdul Wahid Khan's conduct dubious and confirming the legality of the orders passed by the Custodian authorities. The petitioner was entitled to Rs. 29,800 as compensation for construction costs, but his lease was terminated.
punishment: Lease terminated; Rs. 29,800 compensation awarded for construction costs.
legal_arguments: Petitioner argued that the properties were excluded from acquisition under the Displaced Persons (Compensation and Rehabilitation) Act, 1958.
Respondents argued that the petitioner had no vested right in the property and had violated lease terms.

assets.description: Evacuee property plots and shops on Anderson Road, Quetta

statutes: West Pakistan Administration of Evacuee Property Act, 1957
sections: Section 3 of Displaced Persons (Compensation and Rehabilitation) Act, 1958
Section 43(6) of West Pakistan Administration of Evacuee Property Act, 1957

witness_statement.Major T. H. Naqvi: Confirmed encroachment and excess possession by Abdul Wahid Khan.
witness_statement.Shamshad Hussain Zaidi: Verified findings of Major Naqvi and upheld transfer of shops to respondents.

key_issues: Transfer of property under Displaced Persons Act

maxims.Equity: He who comes into equity must come with clean hands.

legal_terms.Evacuee Property: Property left behind by individuals who migrated during partition.
legal_terms.Lease Deed: Legal document outlining terms of property lease.

words_and_phrases.Certiorari: A writ seeking judicial review of a lower court's decision.
words_and_phrases.Mandamus: A writ directing a public official to perform a duty.

summary_vector_notes: The case involved protracted litigation over evacuee property in Quetta. Abdul Wahid Khan's petition was dismissed due to irregularities in his possession and lease terms. The court upheld the Custodian's orders and awarded compensation for construction costs.
